intro: Ludwigia leptocarpa var. angustissima, commonly known as narrow-leaved Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, bright red flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. It is often cultivated in aquatic gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in waterlogged soils. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a popular choice for pond and aquarium plantings.
